summary: This document is an email chain from August 2020 regarding the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) draft report on the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida (2006-2008). It involves the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York requesting team review of the draft report for sensitivity concerns.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the OPR draft report regarding the handling of his case by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006-2008.

events.title: Handling of Epstein Matter by SD Florida
events.description: The period during which the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida handled the Jeffrey Epstein case, which is the subject of the OPR draft report.

events.title: OPR Draft Report Submission
events.description: The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) sends a draft report and cover letter regarding the Epstein matter to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York for review.

events.title: Internal Review Coordination
events.description: An email is sent to coordinate the internal review of the OPR draft report on the Epstein NPA (Non-Prosecution Agreement) among the SDNY team, noting the creation of a searchable version.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, 950 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Room 3266
keyFacts: The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) produced a draft report investigating the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006 to 2008.
The draft report and a cover letter were sent to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York for review in August 2020.
The SDNY team was asked to review the draft for any content sensitive to ongoing investigations.
The correspondence indicates an internal review process within the DOJ regarding the Epstein prosecution's history.
